title: EastEnders spoilers: Pam unites Ben and Callum star calls for return
text:
We love ourselves an ally and Pam Coker (Lin Blakley) makes a welcome return to Walford to check on Ben Mitchell (Max Bowden) – and give him the wake up call that he desperately needs in terms of allowing himself to be happy.

Pam and Ben share the bond of their love for the late Paul and Ben feels guilty about falling in love again, fearing that he is betraying his late love. But Pam thinks quite the opposite and knows that she is seeing something in Callum Highway (Tony Clay) that would make Ben genuinely happy.

Speaking about Pam’s return to the Square, Lin Blakely told Metro.co.uk: ‘She’s come back to get the books as she does from time to time. Once she comes back, she wants to see everyone she loves and the first person she wants to see is Ben. Obviously, she wants him to move on, I feel. She hopes that he is. It was terrible what happened to Paul but Pam knows he needs to move on.

‘I think she senses the love Ben has for Callum. All I will say is that she wants to see Ben move on. She wants him to be a happy soul – she loves him very much so she really wants him to live his life. And she tells him Paul would want him to do that too. There are some lovely scenes in that. Pam is what Ben needs at the moment to tell him that!’

The last time that Pam had scenes with Ben, he was played by Harry Reid but it’s clear Lin has love for both actors who have taken on the role.

She reflected: ‘I had such a lot with Harry and now we have this new Ben. He’s a different actor and another lovely actor, he knows what he is doing. We clicked straight away – I was Auntie Pam straight away so it was so lovely. The relationship with Ben is still there. And the bond is still there with Max.

‘We did a very together scene and it really clicked; even the director said “oh my goodness, we could have taken that first take!” It was lovely for both of us. To click with an actor like that being thrown into a scene with someone he doesn’t know, it was definitely a lovely Pam and Ben situation. You just never know, do you? We had said hello to one another and that was it – he is such a good kid.’

Since leaving EastEnders, Pam has very much kept in touch with her Coker clan – comprised of Roger Sloman (Les) and Jonny Labey (Paul), who is currently competing in Celebrity X Factor.

She told us: ‘Roger and I see every six to eight weeks for a coffee if we can and we text each other – he’s coming to see this play. And we saw me in a play in London – we support one another very much. You can’t be a Les and Pam without having that bond I don’t think. We were sincere about that relationship. You don’t just share that and just say cheerio. You stay in touch.

‘She accepted his cross dressing, he explained what happened to him as a child with his father – things happen in life, don’t they? Pam has accepted that, and it wasn’t a bad thing – but in another sense, now that he’s away from London, perhaps she feels he can be more comfortable in himself and his crossdressing more, I don’t know. There’s still storylines to tell with them. What happened with her son? No-one completely knows that! It might get unfolded sometime.’

And she is supporting Jonny on X Factor, in the hopes that it could open some more exciting doors for him.

She grinned: ‘Isn’t he brilliant!? I saw him on Strictly and then I saw a review at the Hippodrome – he’s an absolute showman. Something big might come out of this. He might go to Vegas, who knows. He has so many talents, he’s great on the guitar – I hope something big happens out of this, he deserves it and he’s a lovely kid. He still keeps in touch with his nan, so that’s nice!

But the big question is – would Lin like to bring Pam back to Walford for good?

She enthused: ‘If the opportunity came up to have Pam back permanentely, I’d be there in a heartbeat. I loved it so much. Coming in through this gates and seeing the boys on the gate was lovely. To have that everyday – it was part of my life for three years and it came at a time it was needed in my life – that would be gorgeous.

‘I came on a three month contract and stayed three years – and that was because of the fans; they kept us there. To be accepted like that is heartwarming, it takes your breath away. I mean that sincerely.

‘She’s like a nan to a lot of characters in the Square. It’s lovely to bring her back so she can see everyone, it’s a blessing and I am thankful for it very much.’

When we told Lin that fans would certainly be behind that and had been sharing excitement at the prospect of another Pam stint, she was genuinely chuffed and added with surprise: ‘I don’t do any social media – probably I should! Are people really excited? How lovely!’

Who’s setting up the petition, then?
